intro: Cotula pedicellata, commonly known as the common daisy or African daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, narrow leaves that are opposite or alternate in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Cotula pedicellata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
